verses.kjv: God, who at sundry times and in divers manners spake in time past unto the fathers by the prophets,
verses.ct: In the past, God communicated with our ancestors through the prophets at many different times and in many different ways.

verses.kjv: Hath in these last days spoken unto us by his Son, whom he hath appointed heir of all things, by whom also he made the worlds;
verses.ct: But in these final days, he has communicated with us through his Son, whom he designated as heir of everything, and through whom he made the worlds.

verses.kjv: Who being the brightness of his glory, and the express image of his person, and upholding all things by the word of his power, when he had by himself purged our sins, sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high;
verses.ct: The Son radiates God's glory and is the exact representation of his nature. He sustains everything by his powerful word. After he had provided cleansing for our sins, he took his seat at the right side of the Majesty in heaven.

verses.kjv: Being made so much better than the angels, as he hath by inheritance obtained a more excellent name than they.
verses.ct: He became as far superior to the angels as the name he inherited surpasses theirs.

verses.kjv: For unto which of the angels said he at any time, Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee? And again, I will be to him a Father, and he shall be to me a Son?
verses.ct: After all, to which angel did God ever say, 'You are my Son; today I have become your Father'? Or again, 'I will be his Father, and he will be my Son'?

verses.kjv: And again, when he bringeth in the firstbegotten into the world, he saith, And let all the angels of God worship him.
verses.ct: And when God brings his firstborn into the world, he says, 'Let all of God's angels worship him.'

verses.kjv: And of the angels he saith, Who maketh his angels spirits, and his ministers a flame of fire.
verses.ct: Regarding the angels, he says, 'He turns his angels into winds, and his servants into flames of fire.'

verses.kjv: But unto the Son he saith, Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of righteousness is the sceptre of thy kingdom.
verses.ct: But about the Son, he says, 'Your throne, O God, lasts forever and ever, and the scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of righteousness.

verses.kjv: Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows.
verses.ct: You have loved righteousness and despised wickedness. That is why God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of joy, setting you above your companions.'

verses.kjv: And, Thou, Lord, in the beginning hast laid the foundation of the earth; and the heavens are the works of thine hands:
verses.ct: He also says, 'You, Lord, established the earth in the beginning, and the heavens are the work of your hands.

verses.kjv: They shall perish; but thou remainest; and they all shall wax old as doth a garment;
verses.ct: They will come to an end, but you will continue. They will all wear out like clothing.

verses.kjv: And as a vesture shalt thou fold them up, and they shall be changed: but thou art the same, and thy years shall not fail.
verses.ct: You will roll them up like a robe, and they will be replaced. But you remain the same, and your years will never run out.'

verses.kjv: But to which of the angels said he at any time, Sit on my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool?
verses.ct: Yet to which angel has God ever said, 'Take the seat at my right side until I turn your enemies into a footstool beneath your feet'?

verses.kjv: Are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister for them who shall be heirs of salvation?
verses.ct: Aren't all angels serving spirits, sent out to help those who are going to inherit salvation?
